info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 20 at 3:04PM EDT until July 20 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR SANILAC AND NORTHEASTERN LAPEER COUNTIES... At 303 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Marlette, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Peck around 310 PM EDT. Sandusky around 315 PM EDT. Croswell and Carsonville around 325 PM EDT. Applegate around 330 PM EDT. Port Sanilac around 335 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Birch Beach, McGregor, Amador, Snover, Juhl, Elmer, Valley Center, Decker, Burnside and Watertown. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
